glsa.title: Perl, Perl Locale-Maketext module: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in the Perl Locale-Maketext module, allowing remote attackers to inject and execute arbitrary Perl code.

description.p: Two vulnerabilities have been reported in the Locale-Maketext module for Perl, which can be exploited by malicious users to compromise an application using the module.
The vulnerabilities are caused due to the “_compile()” function not properly sanitising input, which can be exploited to inject and execute arbitrary Perl code.

impact.p: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, or cause a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
